paper.title: Evaluating Zero-Shot and One-Shot Adaptation of Small Language Models in Leader-Follower Interaction
paper.abstract: Abstract:Leader-follower interaction is an important paradigm in human-robot interaction (HRI). Yet, assigning roles in real time remains challenging for resource-constrained mobile and assistive robots. While large language models (LLMs) have shown promise for natural communication, their size and latency limit on-device deployment.
